item.title: Reasons
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman

do you not see the hypocrisy in crying about people discounting your style as worthless in the same sentence you do exactly that?

Read full topic

item.title: Reasons
item.dc:creator: @the1337legend the1337legend
item.description:
@the1337legend wrote:

[quote=“brownsymcard, post:24, topic:312652”][quote author=the1337legend link=topic=409087.msg3041240#msg3041240 date=1259121920]
you know, anyone could spend 5 minutes on paint doing this.

White backround
new layer
red fill till half where you made your “focal point stand out”.
new layer > cut out a flower or w.e the fuck that is.

i honestly dont see how that takes time?..
[/quote]

A couple things to say about this…

One: Art is rarely about the skill or time put into something. Why do you think Picasso or Pollock are famous? Picasso mastered lengthy perfect realism by 15 but chose to paint abstract. Pollock was one of the most famous and successful painters of all time by simply dripping paint onto a canvas.
Two: “Cut out a flower” I never “cut things out”. I make everything from scratch. If there is a brush, i create the brush. If there is a photo, i take the photo. If there is a texture, I create the texture. The “flower” is entirely done with the pen tool. From now on I’m only posting pixel work or 3d “art” here. (as in hey lets make something look the same way as something else just to prove we can even though a camera will always be able to do 1000x better instantly)

I have a feeling “1337legend” did not zoom in on it at first.[/quote]

read my second post.

Read full topic

item.title: Reasons
item.dc:creator: @brownsymcard brownsymcard
item.description:
@brownsymcard wrote:

la­wl:

too bad pollocks paintings look like total shit

It is sad then that a single painting that looks like total shit is worth more than all of the money ever made by every person on this forum. (But I do agree, one could view his paintings as literally resembling “shit” on canvas.)

item.title: Reasons
item.dc:creator: @brownsymcard brownsymcard
item.description:
@brownsymcard wrote:

[quote=“the1337legend, post:18, topic:312652”]you know, anyone could spend 5 minutes on paint doing this.

White backround
new layer
red fill till half where you made your “focal point stand out”.
new layer > cut out a flower or w.e the fuck that is.

i honestly dont see how that takes time?..[/quote]

A couple things to say about this…

One: Art is rarely about the skill or time put into something. Why do you think Picasso or Pollock are famous? Picasso mastered lengthy perfect realism by 15 but chose to paint abstract. Pollock was one of the most famous and successful painters of all time by simply dripping paint onto a canvas.
Two: “Cut out a flower” I never “cut things out”. I make everything from scratch. If there is a brush, i create the brush. If there is a photo, i take the photo. If there is a texture, I create the texture. The “flower” is entirely done with the pen tool. From now on I’m only posting pixel work or 3d “art” here. (as in hey lets make something look the same way as something else just to prove we can even though a camera will always be able to do 1000x better instantly)

I have a feeling “1337legend” did not zoom in on it at first.

item.title: Reasons
item.dc:creator: @atrox atrox_
item.description:
@atrox wrote:

[quote=“brownsymcard, post:12, topic:312652”]“God forbid someone post something that takes time and thought, not some low res signature/avatar/crapbanner with ripped off brushes renders and fonts like every post by every 10 year old scriptkiddy who thinks they are pro at photoshop.”

“but then what else should we expect from an mmowned member” is a highly presumptuous statement. I have a total of 7 posts there as I hate their community in general. I simply posted this graphic there also where a moderator there asked for a wallpaper version. Does sending a PM about a request tie a person to a community or stereotype?[/quote]

there’s a quote button for a reason…

Read full topic

item.title: Reasons
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“brownsymcard, post:14, topic:312652”]"I hate posting on game forum graphic sections…

Its an abstract vector print that is 3 feet tall by 2 feet wide when printed."

The first part is an opinion not directed towards anyone. The second is answering mopar’s question. Sorry for any confusion/asshole seemingness (new word)[/quote]

I guess I understand why you hate responses like mine, I didn’t mean any insult by it, and it certainly took skill to do what you did, but to me the only ‘art’ I like is stuff that looks like stuff, it’s not the best way to put it but ‘abstract’ things do nothing for me. I don’t really go for deeper meanings, I take things as they are and go on with my life. I have a feeling it’s sort of something every more technically minded people do. Programmers, engineers, mechanics, I don’t know any of them that get this kind of thing.

That is probably why a forum like this doesn’t get you the great feedback this might get on a graphics forum.

Read full topic

item.title: Reasons
item.dc:creator: @brownsymcard brownsymcard
item.description:
@brownsymcard wrote:

“God forbid someone post something that takes time and thought, not some low res signature/avatar/crapbanner with ripped off brushes renders and fonts like every post by every 10 year old scriptkiddy who thinks they are pro at photoshop.”

I was simply showing my dissent over the arrogant post by Mopman.

“but then what else should we expect from an mmowned member” is a highly presumptuous statement. I have a total of 7 posts there as I hate their community in general. I simply posted this graphic there also where a moderator there asked for a wallpaper version. Does sending a PM about a request tie a person to a community or stereotype?

I would have expected to see the post you have made there…

Read full topic

item.title: Reasons
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

[quote=“Elijah, post:10, topic:312652”][quote author=Frell link=topic=409087.msg3019352#msg3019352 date=1257479212]
Make it a smoother design and give it rhythm so your eyes flow through it. When i look at yours my eyes bounce around then hurt from the sharp corners.
[/quote]

What are you talking about? The entry points in this piece are the bottom left, and top right. Your eye is drawn in by the intersection of the geometric and natural forms. The geometric shapes look chaotic, whereas the natural look fluid and serene. All leading to this point in the vertical center, and justified left center.[/quote]
Its fine until i get close to the middle where the thin black designs start.

Read full topic
